ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a greater understanding of italian language. My writing and comprehension ability greatly increased.
This course helped develop my vocabulary and grammatical skills. This course also included more speaking opportunities, so appreciated the ability to develop my oral skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course follows along well with the textbook and the online activities are helpful. The handouts in class also help with understanding and in class discussion helps with speaking ability. It would be nice if the grade breakdown of the course was a little clearer.

Strengths: well-taught. Weaknesses: it would be nice if the course followed the syllabus so we didn't find out about assignments the night before class, some classes felt like busy-work or weren't totally necessary.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student. The Italian Department is wonderful and you learn a lot of italian relatively quickly. I think Italian is a great way to fulfill the language requirement!
